techs.name: Biology
techs.quote: 'If the brain were so simple we could understand it, we would be so simple we couldn't.' - Lyall Watson

techs.name: Electricity
techs.quote: 'Is it a fact - or have I dreamt it - that, by means of electricity, the world of matter has become a great nerve, vibrating thousands of miles in a breathless point of time?' - Nathaniel Hawthorne

techs.name: Steam Power
techs.quote: 'The nations of the West hope that by means of steam communication all the world will become as one family.' - Townsend Harris

techs.name: Dynamite
techs.quote: 'As soon as men decide that all means are permitted to fight an evil, then their good becomes indistinguishable from the evil that they set out to destroy.' - Christopher Dawson

techs.name: Refrigeration
techs.quote: 'And homeless near a thousand homes I stood, and near a thousand tables pined and wanted food.' - William Wordsworth

techs.name: Radio
techs.quote: 'The whole country was tied together by radio. We all experienced the same heroes and comedians and singers. They were giants.' - Woody Allen

techs.name: Replaceable Parts
techs.quote: 'Nothing is particularly hard if you divide it into small jobs.' - Henry Ford

techs.name: Flight
techs.quote: 'Aeronautics was neither an industry nor a science. It was a miracle.' - Igor Sikorsky

techs.name: Railroads
techs.quote: 'The introduction of so powerful an agent as steam to a carriage on wheels will make a great change in the situation of man.' - Thomas Jefferson

techs.name: Automatics
techs.quote: 'Whoever said the pen is mightier than the sword obviously never encountered automatic weapons' -Douglas MacArthur
